column4: ISO/IEC 27001:2013 is an information security standard that was published in September 2013[1] It supersedes ISO/IEC 27001:2005 and is published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) under the joint ISO and IEC subcommittee, ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 27.[2] It is a specification for an information security management system (ISMS). Organizations that meet the standard may be certified compliant by an independent and accredited certification body on successful completion of a formal compliance audit.

column5: Controls
Do Security policies exist?
Are all policies approved by management?
Are policies properly communicated to employees?

column2: Review of the policies for information security
column5: Are security policies subject to review?
Are the reviews conducted at regular intervals?
Are reviews conducted when circumstances change?
Choose from below for which responsibilities are clearly identified?
Choose from below for which responsibilities are clearly defined?
Choose from below for which responsibilities are clearly communicated to the relevant parties?
Are the duties and areas of responsibilities are seperated inorder to reduce opportunities for unauthorized modification or misuse of information or services?
What is the Procedure documented for when and by whom contacting with relevent authorities will be made?
How and when the contact is required?
What is the process for routine contact and intelligence sharing?
Do relevant individuals within the organisation maintain active membership in relevent special interests group?
Do all projects go through some form information security assessment?
Does Mobile device policy Exist?
Does the policy have management aprroval?
What are the additional risks that tha policy adressess from using mobile devices
Is there a policy for teleworking?
Does the policy have management aprroval?
Is there a set of process for remote workers to get access?
Are the teleworkers are given the advice and equipment to protect their assets?
Are background verification checks carried out on all new candidates for employment?
Are these checks are approved by appropriate management authority?
Are the checks complaint with relevent laws regulation and ethics?
What are the levels of Checks?
What Documents signed by the employee?

column2: Do employment or service contracts specifically cover the need to protect business information?
column5: Are managers engaged in driving security within the business
